Motivation.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
Motivation.author: Sam Levenson

Motivation.text: The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it.
Motivation.author: Sudhashree Acharya

Motivation.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Motivation.author: Steve Jobs

Motivation.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
Motivation.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Motivation.text: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
Motivation.author: Winston Churchill

Motivation.text: You can’t be that kid standing at the top of the waterslide, overthinking it. You have to go down the chute.
Motivation.author: Tina Fey

Motivation.text: Perfection is not attainable. But if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
Motivation.author: Vince Lombardi

Motivation.text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
Motivation.author: Sean Patrick Flanery

Motivation.text: Little things make big days.
Motivation.author: Isabel Marant

Motivation.text: It's going to be hard, but hard does not mean impossible.
Motivation.author: Art Williams

Motivation.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
Motivation.author: Sam Levenson

Motivation.text: Get a good idea and stay with it. Dog it, and work at it until it’s done right.
Motivation.author: Walt Disney

Motivation.text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Success doesn't just find you. You have to go out and get it.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Dream bigger. Do bigger.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction.
Motivation.author: Unknown

Motivation.text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.

Happiness.text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
Happiness.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Happiness.text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
Happiness.author: Dalai Lama

Happiness.text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
Happiness.author: Aristotle

Happiness.text: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
Happiness.author: John Lennon

Happiness.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
Happiness.author: Dalai Lama

Happiness.text: Happiness is a warm puppy.
Happiness.author: Charles M. Schulz

Happiness.text: The only joy in the world is to begin.
Happiness.author: Cesare Pavese

Happiness.text: The most simple things can bring the most happiness.
Happiness.author: Izabella Scorupco

Happiness.text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
Happiness.author: Albert Schweitzer

Happiness.text: Happiness radiates like the fragrance from a flower.
Happiness.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Socrates

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Victor Hugo

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Socrates

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: Life must be understood backward. But it must be lived forward.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Søren Kierkegaard

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Aristotle

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: Happiness is not an ideal of reason but of imagination.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Immanuel Kant

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: William Shakespeare

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: John Locke

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Buddha

Wisdom / Philosophy.text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Wisdom / Philosophy.author: Aristotle

Love / Relationships.text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
Love / Relationships.author: William Shakespeare

Love / Relationships.text: We accept the love we think we deserve.
Love / Relationships.author: Stephen Chbosky

Love / Relationships.text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
Love / Relationships.author: Aristotle

Love / Relationships.text: Where there is love there is life.
Love / Relationships.author: Mahatma Gandhi

Love / Relationships.text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
Love / Relationships.author: David Viscott

Love / Relationships.text: Love recognizes no barriers.
Love / Relationships.author: Maya Angelou

Love / Relationships.text: Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do.
Love / Relationships.author: David Wilkerson

Love / Relationships.text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
Love / Relationships.author: Audrey Hepburn

Love / Relationships.text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength.
Love / Relationships.author: Lao Tzu

Love / Relationships.text: Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own.
Love / Relationships.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Success.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
Success.author: Winston Churchill

Success.text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
Success.author: John D. Rockefeller

Success.text: I never dreamed about success. I worked for it.
Success.author: Estée Lauder

Success.text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
Success.author: Henry David Thoreau

Success.text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
Success.author: Colin R. Davis

Success.text: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
Success.author: Chris Grosser

Success.text: Don't let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
Success.author: Robert Kiyosaki

Success.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
Success.author: Winston Churchill

Success.text: If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time.
Success.author: Steve Jobs

Success.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
Success.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Mindfulness.text: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
Mindfulness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Mindfulness.text: The present moment is the only time over which we have dominion.
Mindfulness.author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

Mindfulness.text: Mindfulness is the aware, balanced acceptance of the present experience.
Mindfulness.author: Sylvia Boorstein

Mindfulness.text: Mindfulness isn't difficult, we just need to remember to do it.
Mindfulness.author: Sharon Salzberg

Mindfulness.text: Be happy in the moment, that's enough.
Mindfulness.author: Mother Teresa

Mindfulness.text: In today's rush, we all think too much, seek too much, want too much, and forget about the joy of just being.
Mindfulness.author: Eckhart Tolle

Mindfulness.text: Suffering usually relates to wanting things to be different from the way they are.
Mindfulness.author: Allan Lokos

Mindfulness.text: Each morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
Mindfulness.author: Buddha

Mindfulness.text: Meditation is not evasion; it is a serene encounter with reality.
Mindfulness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Mindfulness.text: Smile, breathe, and go slowly.
Mindfulness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

Funny / Lighthearted.text: I'm not arguing, I'm just explaining why I'm right.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Unknown

Funny / Lighthearted.text: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: A.A. Milne

Funny / Lighthearted.text: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Oscar Wilde

Funny / Lighthearted.text: You can't have everything. Where would you put it?
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Steven Wright

Funny / Lighthearted.text: The elevator to success is out of order. You'll have to use the stairs.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Joe Girard

Funny / Lighthearted.text: If you think nobody cares if you're alive, try missing a couple of car payments.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Earl Wilson

Funny / Lighthearted.text: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Jim Carrey

Funny / Lighthearted.text: I used to think I was indecisive, but now I'm not too sure.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Unknown

Funny / Lighthearted.text: Life is short. Smile while you still have teeth.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Mallory Hopkins

Funny / Lighthearted.text: I'm not lazy, I'm on energy-saving mode.
Funny / Lighthearted.author: Unknown

Historical Figures.text: Give me liberty, or give me death!
Historical Figures.author: Patrick Henry

Historical Figures.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
Historical Figures.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

Historical Figures.text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
Historical Figures.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

Historical Figures.text: I came, I saw, I conquered.
Historical Figures.author: Julius Caesar

Historical Figures.text: That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.
Historical Figures.author: Neil Armstrong

Historical Figures.text: Ask not what your country can do for you – ask what you can do for your country.
Historical Figures.author: John F. Kennedy

Historical Figures.text: Speak softly and carry a big stick.
Historical Figures.author: Theodore Roosevelt

Historical Figures.text: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.
Historical Figures.author: Muhammad Ali

Historical Figures.text: Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!
Historical Figures.author: Ronald Reagan

Historical Figures.text: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
Historical Figures.author: Robert F. Kennedy
